intro: Monopsis stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf monopsis, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and somewhat endangered species in its native range.
